title: How to Delete WhatsApp Messages: Tips for Android & iPhone

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. It's a green app with a white phone and speech bubble icon. [1] X Research source Use this method to delete a message you've sent in a group or one-on-one chat within the last two days. You can do this with Android, iOS, KaiOS, Web and Desktop, Windows, and Mac.

steps.title: Tap Chats.
steps.content: Tap Chats . It's either at the bottom of the screen (iPhone) or the top of the screen (Android). If WhatsApp opens to a conversation, you'll first tap the "Back" button in the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap a conversation from which you want to delete a message.
steps.content: Tap a conversation from which you want to delete a message. Doing so will open it.

steps.title: Tap and hold the message you wish to delete.
steps.content: Tap and hold the message you wish to delete. This will prompt a pop-up bar of options either directly above the message (iPhone) or at the top of the screen (Android). [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . This trash can icon is on the right side of the pop-up bar. [3] X Research source On iPhone, tap More with the three-dot menu icon before tapping Delete . [4] X Research source Also on an iPhone, you can tap multiple messages to select them.

steps.title: Tap Delete for Everyone.
steps.content: Tap Delete for Everyone . After you get a confirmation that "This message was deleted," the message (or messages) will be deleted from the conversation. [5] X Research source In order for the message to be deleted, you and everyone else in the group must be using the latest version of WhatsApp. Though you're deleting the message, the other people you're conversing with might have seen or screenshotted the message before it was deleted. You can tap Delete for Me if you don't want to delete the message for everyone in the conversation. Everyone in the conversation will see "Message Deleted" in place of your message.
